FileWeaver

The FileWeaver plugin assembles files from multiple parts. Parts can be supplied literally in the plugin configuration or read from external files. Configured values can be interpolated into the output as it is written, in place of keyword tokens.

Goals Overview

  • FileWeaver:weave generate files from provided literal text and other files.

Usage

General instructions on how to use the Plugin Name can be found on the usage page. Some more specific use cases are described in the examples given below.

In case you still have questions regarding the plugin's usage, please have a look at the FAQ and feel free to contact the user mailing list. The posts to the mailing list are archived and could already contain the answer to your question as part of an older thread. Hence, it is also worth browsing/searching the mail archive.

If you feel that the plugin is missing a feature or has a defect, you can fill a feature request or bug report in our issue tracker. When creating a new issue, please provide a comprehensive description of your concern. Especially for fixing bugs it is crucial that the developers can reproduce your problem. For this reason, entire debug logs, POMs or most preferably little demo projects attached to the issue are very much appreciated. Of course, patches are welcome, too. Contributors can check out the project from our source repository.
